Title: Tinubu rallies Super Eagles to soar into 2026 World Cup
Summary: President Bola Tinubu has congratulated the Super Eagles on their emphatic 4–0 thrashing of the Cheetahs Benin Republic . President Tinubu applauds their determination in keeping Nigeria’s World Cup dreams alive .

Title: Umuahia residents protest soaring electricity bills
Summary: A cross-section of electricity consumers in Umuahia, on Tuesday, took to the streets to protest against the “outrageous, unbearable and unjustified” bills charged by the Enugu Electricity Distribution Company (EEDC) The protesters, under the aegis of Concerned Residents, marched on the streets .

Title: APC adopts consensus in Ekiti guber primary
Summary: APC adopts consensus mode for conduct of Ekiti State Governorship Primary Election . Mr Felix Morka, the party’s National Publicity Secretary, announced in a statement on Tuesday .

Title: Trump hails ‘martyr’ Charlie Kirk at posthumous medal ceremony
Summary: US President Donald Trump hailed assassinated ally Charlie Kirk as a “martyr for truth and freedom” Tuesday as he posthumously awarded the right-wing activist America’s highest civilian honor . Handing the Presidential Medal of Freedom to Kirk's tearful widow, Trump compared the slain activist to President Barack Obama .

Title: US set to carry out four executions this week
Summary: Samuel Smithers, 72, was sentenced to death by lethal injection on Tuesday . He was convicted of murdering two women he hired for sex . US set to carry out four executions this week .

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, October 15, 2025
Summary: Expect modest volatility in the coming days as importers, corporate end-users and diaspora flows interact with CBN interventions . The exchange rate is expected to remain at the same level today, October 15, 2025 .

Title: I’ve forgiven my daughter-in-law who killed my son —Isa
Summary: Alhaji Bello Isa says he appealed to Buhari, Tinubu to pardon Maryam Sanda . He says he has forgiven his daughter-in-law who killed his son, Bilyaminu Bello .

Title: Amend Section empowering Court to declare winner in election petitions – Prof Ali tells NASS
Summary: Constitutional lawyer, Yusuf Olaolu Ali(SAN) tasked the National Assembly as a matter of urgency to amend section 136 of Electoral Act that empowers the courts or tribunals to declare anybody as winner of any election petitions in the country . The renowned senior lawyer and Kuliya Ngeri, Ilorin based lawyer

Title: Group seeks transparency review in aviation ministry spending
Summary: The Coalition Against Malpractices and Corruption (COMAC) has called for a transparency review of financial transactions and procurement activities in the Federal Ministry of Aviation and Aerospace Development . The group urges relevant institutions to strengthen accountability mechanisms in the sector .

Title: Mbah’s Defection: ‘We have challenges but PDP is not in coma’  —  Ologunagba
Summary: The PDP chieftain argued that the gale of defections in the PDP is orchestrated by the APC through a combination of factors .
